quest.name: Roads Pαved││Sacri┣ice
journal: Alphinaud has regained his composure and is ready to proceed.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We have to keep going. Even if Estinien isn't here to see it, I'm sure Alphinaud wouldn't want to disappoint him.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: No choice have we but to march onward, lest we squander their noble sacrifices...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Though it pains me to say it, we can ill afford to stop and grieve our comrades' passing. No, there will be time enough after.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: To feign bravery with bold words is a simple matter, but without the strength of will to match, we are powerless against dynamis.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Naught less than unshakable conviction will suffice... Which makes me question if I am up to the task.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As Y'shtola and Alisaie said, we must continue.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hmm. Notice the change in our surroundings? Perhaps this is the memory of an altogether different world.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Twould be prudent to learn more of it, then. Tread carefully, lest we lose our footing in this sand.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If not for the light emitted by these glyphs, I might well have overlooked this monolith.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Sand... Sand everywhere. <sigh>

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If you were worried about my vision, you needn't be. I can still see quite well.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Another seemingly barren world... For a mercy, the air is nowhere near as stale, but still quite dry, and the sand will no doubt prove bothersome in due time.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Were it not for the violet crystal embedded in its surface, 'twould appear as ordinary stone.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: A curious script hath been etched upon them. Alas, it is not a language with which I am familiar.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I cannot say I recognize it either.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Nor I. The dragons, from what I recall, preserve their knowledge in song and eschew the written word entirely, so we may assume this is the work of another race. One we have yet to encounter...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Meteion claimed the dragons' world suffered a slow death, seeking the release of oblivion.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: What life we find here, like as not, doth wend its way towards a similar end.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Fascinating as this script is, we will glean naught from what we cannot decipher...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What do you suppose that is over there?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I'm not sure... It's hard to make out at this distance, but its surface seems to bear the same crystals as this monument.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Meaning there's a chance we may find whoever built them both. We should go and have a look. Come on.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: Hail, travelers. This is a most unexpected occurrence.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Oh, um... Hello there. Is this your home...?

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text:
Indeed it is...
Ah, forgive me. I had forgotten─an exchange of introductions is expected when first meeting those with whom one is unacquainted.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: When the vibration of vocal folds was still required to convey our thoughts and intention, “Ea,” I believe, was the pronunciation used when referring to our people.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: Though it is not entirely applicable given our present state, you are welcome to use this appellation.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: As for nomenclature to address my individual person, I believe it would be pronounced “Coph-coodg.”

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)Yes. Coph-coodg, of the Ea.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We have encountered beings that communicate intermittently through thought, but never one that is wholly without voice.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I presume we are having this conversation via the medium of aether. Or dynamis, as this space is suffused with vast quantities of it. Fascinating in either case.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)I gather your response to my presence is positive, then? That is well, for there is something I wish to ask of you.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)Like yourselves, we Ea are aether-based life-forms. Therefore, it may be surmised that your bodies are of comparable biological composition to those we once possessed.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)I have a number of queries regarding your subjective perception of the five senses─sight, sound, taste, touch, and smell.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)In total, I have prepared one hundred ninety-eight billion seven hundred twelve million one hundred eighty thousand eight hundred and twenty-seven.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Er... That's rather a lot, isn't it?

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)Ah, my apologies. I have omitted a great many details necessary to understand the nature of my request.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)Though we dispensed with our corporeal vessels long ago, we have rediscovered a need for the flesh, and have endeavored to recreate our erstwhile forms. However, all pertinent records have been lost due to the passage of time.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)Take for example, the nervous system. It is well within our power to recreate, but we have no frame of reference for sensations once experienced by our people, which may compromise our ability to interact with our physical environment.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: And the reason you need to regain corporeal forms?

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)Why, to bring an end to our existence, of course.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)Though “need” is perhaps too strong a word. It would be a simple matter to unmake ourselves through use of aetheric exsanguinaters. But such a death seems...inadequate.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)The traditionalists among us believe proper death requires an inescapable sense of impermanence in one's final moments. An experience found only with bodies of flesh.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We should very much like to hear more of your plans. In exchange, we will answer any questions you have to the best of our ability.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)Hmm... Such an exchange of information would indeed prove useful.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)Very well. To ensure efficacious exchange, I hereby invite you to our home.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)Yes. The abode of the Ea, where we traditionalists prepare for our demise.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)I presume your consent to answer questions is indicative of a tacit approval of our plans? In which case, your cooperation is greatly appreciated.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: (-Coph-coodg-)I must caution you, however, to be mindful of the Ea wandering the desert. Their desire for bodies of flesh could be described as...overzealous. Now, if you would follow me.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This is going rather smoothly. Not that I'm complaining, mind.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Even so, we mustn't forget their aim is oblivion, much like the dragons.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Though I fail to see why a civilization so seemingly advanced would choose to unmake all they have created.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: At any rate, we will find no answers dallying here. Let us be on our way.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Something tells me we have different definitions of the word “abode.”

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: They said there would be others, but... I don't know what I was expecting.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The isle of dragons was shrouded in the silence of the dead, yet the stillness here doth suggest the Ea are, by and large, merely sleeping...?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I should not be surprised their concept of a village is so different from ours, and yet...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: More violet-colored crystals. I cannot place my finger on it, but there is something unsettling about them.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: Welcome to our abode. Most of our compeers, you will find, remain idle in their domiciles. Though your quizzical expressions indicate my phrasing is unclear.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: I speak, of course, of the violet crystalline constructs hanging from the stone structures there.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You say they remain idle, but what of your work to regain corporeal bodies?

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: An astute question. And understandable, given your finite nature.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: We have no desire to pursue our research, for it is no longer necessary.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: If, in our idleness, we are struck by sudden inspiration, we rise to pursue said inspiration to its conclusion. That is why I was present for your arrival, and why I continue to engage with you still.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: But while the others are not currently in a motile state, rest assured they would not object were you to disturb their respite.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: You need only cast your thoughts towards one of their crystalline domiciles to communicate.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: Even should they elect not to emerge, you need but cast your thoughts to the crystals to communicate with the Ea within.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I suppose there is a logic to creatures comprised of spiritual energy utilizing crystals as living spaces, but it is nevertheless surprising to see.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I've tried reaching out to whatever is inside this crystal, but all I can hear is sporadic moaning.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Despite my best efforts, mine overtures have elicited no response from this crystal. I can but assume its resident sleepeth most soundly. Or so I hope...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Is it not strange they lack passion to research that which they desire above all else?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If we are fortunate, the Ea residing in these crystals will shed light on this contradiction.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If I heard correctly, the Ea within this crystal says it will emerge from within shortly. Do you suppose they all appear as Coph-coodg does?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You cast your thoughts toward the crystalline domicile, but there is no response...

dialogue.name: LAHLAAKH
dialogue.text: (-???-)You... You wish...to speak...?

dialogue.name: LAHLAAKH
dialogue.text: (-???-)Very well... Pray...a moment, if you would...

dialogue.name: DEWDEEKH
dialogue.text: (-???-)Why we seek our end, you ask? If you wish to know, I will tell you.

dialogue.name: DEWDEEKH
dialogue.text: (-???-)Just a moment... I must remember... What form did I take when last I emerged?

dialogue.name: UNKNOWNEA04456
dialogue.text: ...Errrgh... Aghhh...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The strange moaning comes and goes, but soon fades into silence...

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: Did your inquiries yield satisfactory responses?

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: I see...

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: If they failed to answer, then it is likely because their minds have unraveled due to prolonged idleness. They are naught but concentrated aether now.

dialogue.name: COPHCOODG
dialogue.text: Worry not─there are no others who have need of those lodgings, and they will not prove a hindrance to remain as they are. But more importantly, you said some few did answer your request for an audience, yes? I imagine they will be with us ere long.
